page.title: 15CRIME PROTECTION
page.content: Shildon, as any town, has its share of crime but recently various schemes have been introduced by the Police with the cooperation of the community. One of these schemes is known as 'Neighbourhood Watch'. The idea is that residents keep their eyes and ears open for suspicious behaviour etc. and report these to an appointed neighbour who has volunteered to act as a liaison with the Police. A pilot scheme has been set up and has proven to be worthwhile. Other areas are now being set up in the town as Police manpower permits. Another scheme to combat break-ins and vandalism to schools is called 'Crimewatch'.Schools in the scheme are fitted with burglar alarms and children are made aware of this.The scheme is working well,in conjunction with the Community policeman in school
